column4: Hi everyone, I am in a terminal at the moment, trying to execute a .jar file, but all I am getting is an error: "Failed to load Main-Class manifest attribute from...2
Hi everyone, I am in a terminal at the moment, trying to execute a .jar file, but all I am getting is an error: "Failed to load Main-Class manifest attribute from..."*
Does anyone know how to execute a .jar file from the terminal?
I'm sure the java program can do that
I did 'java -jar thejar.jar' and it returned that error ^^^
Ooh, error... what was the msg?
Failed to load Main-Class manifest attribute from theJarfile.jar
It's not the jar file either, it happens with all of them, from multiple sources.
Hmm, not sure - I'll google what I can
You're using the java that's installed...?
It's the java-common package, if I can recall correctly
I just install the JDK from Sun's site
I'll give that a go. Hand about.
hyperb0lix/sleepy009: installing JDK fixed it, I now ever have an option when right clicking the file to run in java runtime environment, thanks all for help - Becky out.
